smtools.swing.dialogs
Class JIncompleteWarningDialog

java.lang.Object
  smtools.swing.dialogs.JIncompleteWarningDialog

public final class JIncompleteWarningDialog
extends java.lang.Object

The JIncompleteWarningDialog class pops up a standard dialog box for incomplete implementations.

Note that this class cannot be instantiated, nor can it be subclassed; use the static warn(java.awt.Component, java.lang.String) method instead. A valid Messages database must be available!

Depending on the application's current look-and-feel, the dialog box looks as follows:

    Java Metal L&F

    Microsoft Windows L&F

    Motif L&F

Note that this class cannot be subclassed!

Version:
22/01/2004
Author:
Sven Maerivoet

Method Detail

warn

public static void warn(java.awt.Component parentComponent,
                        java.lang.String className)
Pops up a up a standard dialog box for incomplete implementations.

This method should be called as follows:

    JIncompleteWarningDialog.warn(parent,className);

Note that a valid Messages database must be available!

Parameters:
parentComponent - the frame in which this dialog is to be displayed
className - the name of the not-yet-implemented package, class (and method) to warn about
